s important because: 
• Most expulsions in the immediate postpartum occur by 6 weeks hence this visit must include examination of the
pat
ient to mitigate risk of unrecognized expulsion and unintended pregnancy.
• The strings can be trimmed and any concerns addressed.
• Post insertion care should be re-iterated
• There is limited evidence for use of ultrasound confirmation of placement.
